Name: TessWes Mize
Title: Much larger than other Gerber 0-3 onesies...no size consistency!
Review: Ordered this because my 2 month old is too long for newborn size but too small weight wise for 3 month size. The 0-3 short sleeve onesies we have from Gerber are the only thing that fits her so I figured the long sleeve style would be the same. The photo I'm posting shows the two styles, supposedly the same size, side by side. It is so frustrating that there's no consistency in baby clothes sizing, but one would assume that sizing would at least be consistent within the same company!

Name: Jess
Title: Extremely small!
Review: Get these at least two sizes bigger!! I ordered the 3 month and open opening, they already looked too small, like newborn. I washed them once and they literally are now preemie size.

Name: Scott B.
Title: Too small
Review: Way to small. Bought for a 6 lb baby and the arms are way to long but the body length is about 4 inches too short. On top of that the material is very very thin. I'll stick with the Carter versions from here on as they are true to size, softer and thicker.

Name: E.T.
Title: These are TINY!
Review: I love the idea of having snap buttons and mitten cuffs. Other reviews have said that these run small, so I order the 0-3 months instead of new born size. They're still tiny. Pictures are included for you to see. I laid a shirt on top of the Gerber sleep n play. As you can see, both garments are labeled the same size, but the sleep n play is much bigger.

Name: Amazon Customer
Title: Not easy to put on
Review: I have a small baby but this is not easy to put on even with his small size.  The head and shoulder part is big enough, the problem is with the long sleeve, it’s super hard to put the whole hand and arm through, not good with a baby crying.

Name: Alesa
Title: Runs small, little stretch
Review: Runs smaller. 2 buttons instead of the normal 3. Ordered 0-3 months and would say it’s more newborn size

Name: Tara
Title: Way too small! Get 0-3 for your newborn and they may last them a month
Review: I was so excited to find these but they’re not big enough for 0-3. He just outgrew the newborn size of these, but the 0-3 month are barely any bigger! In fact, now that I’ve dried them, they look the same size.  They’re so tight around his bottom like the newborn ones were getting and too short to cuff his hands. The 0-3 month are the ones I wish I started him out on as a newborn. He’s 2 months old and I know all babies come in different sizes but 3 month onesies are normally big on him... These are just way too small. It’s a bummer bc I want those mitten cuffs and you just cant find them anywhere for 0-3. I want to return these, but seriously, what a bummer. I need some mitten cuff onesies!

Name: Emily Dahlquist
Title: Poor quality fabric
Review: Fabric is poor quality material. Thinner than most onesies. So thin it is transparent. Very low thread count.I got these onesies for the long sleeve/mits and they work well for that.

Review: I got these for my newborn because I love the onesies with the mitten covers for when she sleeps. But the first time I washed them, before she even wore them, they shrunk significantly. I washed them with cold water and dried on very low. Had to return them because they wouldn’t fit her, and she is not a big baby.

Name: Alessandra Abreu
Title: Mmmm...
Review: Not really. Too thin. The collar is super large, and got deformed. I hand wash my babies clothes.

Review: I was really disappointed in this purchase. The onesies had a bad odor...like cheese, and 2 of them have snags in them so I am unable to use them for my Etsy shop. I would have returned by I had an order that I had to get out asap so i washed and used one of the ones that didn't have a snag in it. Will not repurchase from this seller.

Name: Yanderley arias
Title: ... only because these really are soft and my son enjoyed the 2 times he got to wear them
Review: The two stars I am giving this product are only because these really are soft and my son enjoyed the 2 times he got to wear them..Gerber baby clothing does not last because as soon as you wash them once, they shrink.I wash my sons clothing with cold water on the gentle cycle and dry on low and after washing these once and realizing they shrunk to newborn size, I had to go through the rest of his clothing set aside for when he got bigger and realized my 2 month old had to wear his 6-9 gerber clothes now or else he’d never get to fit into them...

My baby looked like his fly was open all the time. Also the arms were very tight and pretty difficult to take on an off. Cheaply made and packaged compared to carters brand. I ordered two packages of these and unfortunately wont be using.

Name: Kessia Eugene Harris
Title: Disappointing product quality
Review: I hardly ever write a product review. The last time I wrote one was in 2015 when a product i purchased exceeded my expectation. However I have to write about this product because although I read the bad reviews I was hoping for better. I was absolutely disappointed and would like to spear others as well. The quality of this "Gerber" product is aweful. I would NEVER purchase this in a store had I felt the fabric and saw the stitching of this. First of all, the 4 pj's in the pack are not all the same size. 2 of them are at least a size and a half smaller than the other 2. I ordered new born this looks like its for a 6-9 month old. The fabric quality feels so cheap. I can tell it would not survive 2 weeks of wash and wear. I highly doubt this is an authentic Gerber, it said its made in Thailand. If it is its probably the defective products that are being sold at a cheaper price on Amazon so i guess you get what you pay for. I thought the glittery look was part of the fabric. Its actually glued on. I would NEVER put an outfit with the possibility of glitter falling off on a baby's new born skin. Or run the risk of it going into her eyes. LET ME SAVE U THE QUESTION OF WHETHER TO BUY OR NOT....DO NOT BUY unless you are ok with cheap poorly made quality on your baby.

Name: Yay Me!

Review: I bought a preemie and the size description says up to 17 inches…smh this is a lie because my daughter measures 19 and is 5lbs and preemie is humongous on her still.

Review: I specifically ordered these because my baby's tiny hands get chilly if he doesn't have mitten cuffs, and so I wanted more footie pajamas with mitten cuffs. It says mitten cuffs from premie to 6 months. There were NO MITTEN CUFFS! I am very disappointed.

Review: These are ok if quality isn’t what your looking for. Super thin and scratchy feeling. I don’t think I’ll be buying Gerber clothes anymore.

Name: Sarah Abbate
Title: Zippers Immediately Broke
Review: I purchased a pack of 4.  Upon the very first use of ALL FOUR sleepers, the zippers immediately broke.  Really helpful to parents upon arriving home from the hospital with a newborn, trying to quickly change sleepers after baby has peed through the first pair. Also this is baby #2 so we are not new to using sleepers… or zippers in general.  We are also not weightlifting world champions who don’t know their own strength.  This is just an extremely cheap product.

Name: Elisabeth C.
Title: Cute not comfy
Review: Ok so definitely cute. Who doesn’t love a cute baby 24/7?! *BUT* there are some buts.Pros:- cute. So cute!- footies AND mittens. Love mittens on PJs. Should be a requirement!- Zipper (I hate snaps) but zipper is only a top / one way zipper- Price - can’t beat it!CONS:- one way zipper that is only from the top. My baby HATES having her skin exposed when there’s a chill in the air in the middle of the night so having to expose her whole tummy when trying to change her diaper is not good.- Softness = 0/5. Baby clothes, especially pjs, are supposed to be soft! When I opened them I thought they were scratchy feeling, but I like this baby clothes brand so I took the tags off and washed them, thinking that they would just soften right up. Nope. While they are no longer scratchy, they still aren’t soft. Could be that they need a few more washes but very disappointing right out of the gate.-super thin. Great for summer not great for Colorado fall and winter.-They aren’t stretchy. This is neither here nor there for me really, but I know that this could be a big con for parents.I will come back and update my review if they dramatically change softness in the next wash or two (or three).

Name: Worldly Church Girl
Title: Cute but JESUS they were FUNKY!!!!🤮
Review: These onesies are the cutest things. I couldn’t believe when I opened up the package the amount of FUNK that came out. It smelled like a baby had boo booed, threw up on it, and they put them in the oven on 350,  and while it was still warm air tight sealed it,  then put it in the package and sent them to me. If it weren’t so cute, I would’ve sent it back!!!  I washed them and put them in the dryer with five fabric softener sheets to get the unGodly smell out.  I don’t know what y’all did, but please stop it, so we don't receive funky BABY clothes.

Name: Christopher
Title: Zipper teeth coming apart after 2 weeks
Review: At first I loved these for my four month old (we got 3/6 months - she’s 13lbs) because they’re lightweight but enough to keep her warm. I ordered them on October 30th, it is November 10th and two of the four pajamas have already come off the tracks when I zipped them up. I had high hopes for these, maybe I just got a bad batch.

Name: Camille Farrell
Title: These do not have a double zipper and are not very soft :(
Review: Not terrible but not my favorite. I was very disappointed that these didn't have the double zipper, which is crucial in my opinion.

Review: I bought these for the mitten cuffs and the clouds/elephant style doesn't even have them. Super disappointing; and I didn't notice until I had already cut the tags and washed them.I also bought the "green animals" set and those had the mitten cuffs. All sets are advertised as having cuffs for premie to 6 months. I would return the two sets if I could.

Name: J. Brooks
Title: Huge! Mislabeled?
Review: The 6-9 fits more like a 12 month!!

Name: Rachael S
Title: No Hand Cuff (as advertised)
Review: These are advertised as having the cuffs for all the sizes. When our newborn sized up to 0-3 mo they had the cuff. However when we sized up again to 3-6 month they came without the hand cuff. This was the main reason I liked these - no sperate gloves! It shows it still being advertised as with cuff for all sizes. I feel jaded and ripped off. Oh well. Don't make the same mistake as I did - no hand cuffs in the 3-6 month size!

Name: Kristina Hartig

Review: Not soft and no zipper from foot.

Name: Mary Davis
Title: Too large, weird cut, and zipper issues
Review: My daughter was born smaller than we anticipated, 0-3 proved way too big and she was getting to be just a shy too big for her premie pajamas we ran out to buy. I was desperate to get pajamas as early as possible while recovering from my c-section so I had hoped these would be my saving grace.Non-spoiler: They’re not. And I wish I paid attention to reviews.Issues:-Waaaay too big, compared to other brands and the premie pajamas we have.-Zippers get caught and split, happened immediately on the blue rainbow  and I thought it was a fluke but all over them have this issue-2 out of the 4 have a warped right leg that twist and irritate my daughter and need constant correction.I’ll keep them for when I need to wash her other items, but def will not be buying again. Desperate or not.

Name: Jennifer Sugilio
Title: Smelled.
Review: This was a gift and it's embarrassing that there was a foul odor when it arrived. Other than that fits great just smelled very bad had to wash it 3 times

Name: Jenny Nong
Title: Cute and great for the price
Review: I have a 2.5 month old and she is growing length wise like crazy so we've had to purchase several new sleep n' play footies to keep accommodating. These are a little thinner than I would have wanted for winter but the design and price are unmatched. I've learned that when buying baby clothes, read the size chart. Gerber tends to run a little larger/provides more room for babies to grow than some other brands. Now my baby has room to stretch out her arms and legs before we need to size up again.There were only 2 negative things I noticed after purchasing. Upon opening, there was this weird smell, almost like a chemical but it went away after washing the clothes. I washed the clothes twice to make sure there wasn't anything residual that got on my baby. The second was that with this pack of designs I didn't realize that the polka dots and the little castles were glitter. I didn't notice any glitter falling after wash or when she was wearing it so far  but also don't know if it will start peeling/falling off later on and hopefully my baby doesn't ingest any.

Name: Cori Moore
Title: Gross after washing
Review: My baby has been using these since Nov. 2021. They fit as expected and are "loose". The material is gross though. After one wash you could tell the fabric would not hold up for a long period of time. She has been wearing them for about 2 months (which she wasnt very mobile during majority of her use in them) and honestly they will go straight to the trash once she outgrows them. They are very faded, have significant pilling, and hold on to any stain imaginable. Also, they are not breathable and it feels like shes wearing plastic honestly. She has the other type that are cotton and those have held up much better and she seems cooler in them, though the fabric feels a little thicker. If you plan to buy these and are okay with them going straight to the garbage after their use, then get them. If you want to hold on to them for hand me downs then do not purchase!

Name: Theresa Hoffman
Title: Bad fabric, Bad fit
Review: I never once felt good about putting her in these because of the feel of the fabric.  It is not soft and whatever visual appeal there is from the cute print is quickly ruined because of it pilling when washed. If I buy polyester again it's going to be the  fleece, not this jersey stuff.As for the fit I don't like that it is only a half sleeve as I use these when it is cold and that leaves half of her arm exposed.  Also, I did not find them to be "loose fitting" longways. I bought size 12mos for my 6 month old who is about 18lbs, figuring she'd have some room to grow into these. She only fit them for a couple weeks before the crotch was too snug and would squish her diaper in the middle of the night so either I would catch her sleeping in a puddle or she would wake up because her clothes were all wet from the diaper leaking.  It took me 3 times of doing all this cleaning her up in the middle of the cold night when she's wanting to sleep for me to realize it wasn't the diaper it was this dang sleeper! I was happy with my other purchase of the cotton snug fitters those I got in size 18 mos which gives me enough room to get her in them and extra space for her thigh chunk.

Name: Pryce Parker

Thank goodness I bought these when my daughter was wearing 6-9 months vs newborn/ 0-3 because I lost so much hair in the beginning. I would have burned these out of frustration if I had them early on. $30 for 3 pairs of baby pjs because I liked the design but I never use them....I'm so scared of missing hairs and giving my daughter a hair tourniquet. She had a bad one on her toe when she was little before I heard about them. Not worth the money, not cute enough to risk another hair tourniquet.

Title: Runs large, not top quality.
Review: I have some 18m footed pajamas that are Carter's brand that my baby has grown out of so I decided it was time to get her some new jammies. I chose to go with these because I've been pretty happy with Carter's brand, but the size jump was ridiculous. I realize there was a slight difference in the branding, so after a quick Google search I found that Simple Joy's by Carter is Amazon exclusive which explains the inconsistency in size and difference in fabric... and the fact the Amazon exclusive brand quality doesn't quite compare to Target or Carters itself. I don't hate them, and hopefully in a few months my toddler will fit them. The fabric is extremely lightweight and breathable which will be great for summer in a few months. The patterns are adorable and when she finally fits into them we'll get some good use, it's just important to note that they run big and aren't as high quality as what you'll find directly through Carters or Target.. and if you're trying to size up from one of those Carter brands your best bet is to actually buy the same size (which I think I'm going to do.)

Review: I would love to buy another pair but I don't think it would be worth the money.

Name: Kat
Title: slightly disappointed
Review: The quality of the jeans are good. It is a well made brand. I was disappointed with a few points that may have more reflection in the distribution offices of this product. 1st: the product came wrapped in a plastic bag to protect the product, which most products do, but that bag had been manually opened in the middle of the bag. I don't have a problem if the item was returned from a previous order and then shipped to me, however they could have at least changed its packaging. 2nd: since there was a rip in the plastic bag, this allowed the jeans to get a greasy filth around the button of the pants and all around the belly rim area. See attached picture. Gross! 3rd: the jeans where a LOT darker than pictured. It's misleading.

Name: Meghan M Van Ormer
Title: Disappointed.
Review: Product fits well, I like the style. They are more denim like than other 'jeans' on the market but the latest two pairs did not hold up while being gently worn. They rip and tear in weird places. I suggest skipping on these.

Name: Mom of too many
Title: Odd but decent
Review: I've been on the search for some toddler jeans that my son can play in and not feel like they are too tight on him to move around as real jeans can be. These have worked out very well, the only problem I have found is the button is hard to clasp on his own and there is no zipper on the fly. Although, it does have an elastic waistband with adjustable buttons to help hold the pants up for children with no buts or not wearing a belt. I find those two features quite odd for toddler jeans...

Name: Theresa King
Title: Okay, knees don't hold up very long
Review: I've bought three pairs now, one in 3T and two in 4T. I love that they have the adjustable sizing bands inside the waist, and they seem very comfortable. Now the downside:  the first pair got two holes in the knees pretty quickly, but I figured it was because he fell while running on cement, twice. I ordered the 4T in May 2021 and only a few months later one of the knees has a hole in it. I don't remember any particularly hard play happening in these, so I don't know why they would be tearing. However, the price is hard to beat, especially when it's also shipped to your door -- very useful during this pandemic! I ordered another pair and they arrived Oct 24th, and by Jan 28th they already have a hole in one knee.  I could try patching them, but it's still a little frustrating.

Name: Joy
Title: Looks good feels good
Review: I use these for work and boy does it feel and look good.  It's hard to keep the ladies off me. They also want to pinch my cheeks when I'm in these jeans if u know what I mean 😉

Name: Cora V.
Title: Too long
Review: Legs too long

Name: Keri Cammarano
Title: Cute
Review: Tight legged. More so than I expected. But good quality Jean

Name: Lisa I
Title: Good value
Review: For the price I paid I am happy with the jeans but the picture does not match the product sent. I ordered the two pack with two distinct acid wash type colors and seeing them in person you can barely notice the difference between them - they are both a pretty deeply saturated blue. They are also somewhat unflattering once the waist is adjusted by only a few loops and look puffy on the hips. The fact that they were a good price and seem to be well made is why I'm giving 4 stars anyway.

Name: justafan
Title: Right size for my slim kid
Review: I have two slim kids and most pants we are either a size too big or small. This brand's pants are the most true to their age. So my 3 year old wears 3T. When my big kid was 3, he would wear 3T and with other brands it is usually a size 2 or sometimes a size 4. These always seemed to work. And they last to give to cousins.

Name: Susan
Title: Little Boys Jeans
Review: Made well.  Great great value.  Fits great.

Name: Mrs. P
Title: Great Quality
Review: I bought these for my 4 year old, and he loves wearing them. They are super comfortable on him. I highly recommend. Also, they originally sent me the wrong item, but fixed it, and sent the right ones immediately. Great customer service and great product.

Name: Susan Tessmann
Title: Soft

Name: ninabella💗

Name: christin
Title: Good Fit and a good pick for my son.
Review: They fit well and they look good. They are a good quality pair of jeans. I'm glad I bought them for my 4 year old son.

Name: Rebekah
Title: Nice looking jeans!
Review: I love the wash on these! Really pretty dark blue. I probably could have ordered a size bigger, but that's on me for underestimating how much my baby has grown. Really nice sturdy material and has a good elastic on the waist for easy on/off. I definitely would (and most likely will!) purchase more of these as my baby grows. Looks very handsome in them!

Name: Happy Dancer 66
Title: Great fit and long enough for a tall child.
Review: My 2 year old grandson is tall and out of diapers so these jeans are a great fit.  The 2T is perfect for a child that no longer wears diapers and 24 month size is too short.

Name: Kaitlyn
Title: These are NOT Carter’s brand socks
Review: These are decent socks, but they are in no way Carter’s brand. They do not say Carter’s on the bottom, and they are not the same size as Carter’s socks. The seller is lying about the branding. It’s a “good” deal for the amount of socks, so it’s very deceitful that they would lie about the brand. These socks could have possibly been used (I ordered new) the pairs were not attached to each other with the little plastic piece. They were also just thrown in a bag. If you’re a stickler on brand these socks are not for you, if you’re looking for a good deal however, these are the socks for you.

Name: JK
Title: flimsy material. advertised 100% cotton but only 70%. bad quality socks.
Review: i am surprised at such great reviews. do people not touch the socks and realize how bad quality they are. pure cotton socks have such a great feel and this feels coarse like a sand paper. cheap knockoff product. my recommendation is to stay away from it.

Name: gwyniffer
Title: Comically large
Review: I ordered the size 2T-3T for my 2 year old and they are basically large enough to fit me, a grown woman. So I guess if you are looking for adult sized socks that are kid themed, these would do the trick. If you are trying to order socks for a child, look elsewhere.

Name: Fishgill
Title: Carter’s introduces one time use socks!
Review: These socks rip on the first wear. I put them in the wash when we got them and right into the sock drawer. Should have put them straight in the trash. It would have saved some time and discomfort. When the first pair ripped on the first wear I shrugged. When the second pair did the same I had a bad feeling. The third ripped. The fourth ripped and I only put them on my kid for a nap. Naps don’t rip socks but poor quality socks will rip during naps. Save your money buy a different brand

Name: Erikka N.
Title: Huge!
Review: These would fit my 6 year old, not 2 year old! Ordered 2t-3t

Name: Nk
Title: Not what was advertised
Review: I ordered these because the description said 100% cotton. The label on the product states 70% cotton, 28% polyester.

Name: Destiny Fiedler
Title: 2t - 3t socks can fit my feet (shoe size 9 1/2 womens)
Review: HUGE! My kid probably won't fit into these until he's like 6 or 7 years old...I fit into these socks and my shoe size is slightly bigger for women (size 9 1/2)

Name: Amazon Customer
Title: Way too big!
Review: I ordered 2t-3t and these particular socks are larger than the 4t-5t socks of the same brand that I've bought for my older child. No where close to fitting my 2 year old who wears a size 6 shoe.

Name: PH
Title: Came loose and not packaged together and quality wasn't expected
Review: I wonder if these socks were tried on returned by someone else. Makes me a little uneasy. They came loose in a plastic bag. The socks weren't attached as they should have been when you buy a package of socks. There was a Carter's postcard in the bag. They are soft but I was expecting thicker quality from Carter's.

Name: Giacomo Valentino
Title: Lasted 2 months :(
Review: The style and fit were really great, and the value of the 12-pair pack was good at the time. However, we've had to throw out 3 pairs already for gnarly holes under the big toes, and the skid-free tabs on the soles have all come off. We wear socks indoors, and admit my son is really active and slides around hardwood floors in his socks and twirls on his big toe. But a few weeks worth of wear, I cannot recommend these socks and will not be reordering... at least not until we're back to wearing shoes to school.

Name: Zelmgid
Title: No grips!
Review: NO GRIPS! I carefully read the Q&A to see if the 12-24 month socks had grips and Simple Joys stated they did. Sadly these do not and would be a disaster for a young walker on wood floors.

Name: Crissy
Title: Way too big
Review: These are labeled 0 - 3 months which is what I ordered, but they are clearly not. They are far too large. I’m not sure if this is a manufacturing defect or a labeling error, but they are easily 2 to 3 times larger than actual 3month size socks. A 3T maybe. Photo is attached with label, and another with a 0-3m sock and a quarter for reference.I didn’t even open them so I can’t speak to quality. The colors and patterns are accurate to what I ordered.

Name: Jean B.
Title: Size 2T/3T is way too big - sizing is off
Review: Haha. I should have listened to some of the reviews that talked about these being WAY TOO BIG. It’s true.  My son is two years old and wearing size 2T. I think these are made for at least a five year old. i’m guessing this is some kind of overstock situation and that’s why the sizing is off. Pic attached for where the heel is on him.We’re going to have him wear these at night, instead of returning them. They are soft and have nice and bright colors. I just wish the sizing was accurate. Now I have to find some 2T to wear in the daytime.

Name: Janine
Title: Huge
Review: 2t-3t is huge. Might return.  2 stars because they are cute.

Name: LC
Title: Not the same quality as before.
Review: I'm extremely disappointed with the change in quality in the materials that these socks are made of. The 3 pairs on the right were bought in May 24th, 2018 (1 1/2 year ago) and they have been used and abused by a toddler that walks in socks all over the house.The 3 socks on the left where bought in August 13th, 2019 (Not even 2 months ago) and they have been used by the same toddler that now goes to school, therefore he uses shoes more time. They look AWFUL. It immediately showed this bad after the first wash.Definitely not the quality that I was expecting.

Name: LBF
Title: Don’t stay up
Review: These socks seem to fit my 10 month old when first put on - but constantly come off his feet and never stay put. If I put booties over them, they stay on longer. I would recommend a taller sock or one with more grabby material that stays up. For the price point, they are not soft or thick at all. I’ll be donating all of these to charity.

Name: Stats Dork
Title: Not slip-proof, very stretchy
Review: These have a little bit of cling but not enough to keep from slipping. Also they are very stretchy and don’t stay put. Won’t buy again.

Name: Amanda
Title: Not correct fabric information
Review: They are only 70% cotton!

Name: Bluebonnet Momma
Title: Grippies or Grips not very helpful
Review: The quality of the socks are wonderful and my child loves the cute designs and prints, however I was displeased with their ability to help with slipping on hardwood floors and tile. The grips are not very big and they do not do as well as some other brands we have had in the past (hence the reason for 3 stars). If the product is advertised as "non skid" I would expect.

Name: Amazon Customer
Title: Too big
Review: These seem like descent socks. But sadly way too big. In this picture it’s a newborn sock, and I ordered size 0-3 month. There’s no way my 3 month old will fit into these, they look huge! I’ll keep them for when his feet are bigger, but I’m sad that they’re not actually 0-3 month, since he needs socks that fit now.

Name: Cheryl Winkler
Title: Way too big and a bit thin, but very soft
Review: My son is a large 10 month old.  The 6-12 month socks are way too small for him so naturally I bought the 12-24 month size.  Unfortunately they are way too BIG!  I will keep them but he probably won't be ready to wear them for several more months.  No idea what to do in the meantime :/However they are soft and I think they will be good socks later on.

Name: Jen B.
Title: Too big
Review: We bought these and have other carter socks the same size but these are clearly bigger than those and don’t fit. Only good thing is eventually they will fit

Name: JLM
Title: Not non-slip enough.
Review: Socks are fine but we have hardwood floors and these just don't keep the little one from slipping on them. There is very little of the non-slip pads and they are mostly centered in the middle of the foot. Not sure about anyone else but my little spends most of the time on the ball or heel so these just don't work for us.

Name: Jen K.
Title: Not grippy enough
Review: I wanted to love these socks, which are made of high quality material, fit well, and have cute patterns. Unfortunately the gripper bottoms are pretty useless, and my son falls when running on our hardwood floors in them. We haven’t had this problem with socks from other brands.

Name: Justin R. Rolling
Title: Disappointed
Review: I was sorely disappointed to learn that these socks do not have grippers on the bottom. I purchased a different set of colored socks from Carter’s for an older child and had no issues. Now, I hope to find a child who can use these socks that may have carpeting throughout the home.

Name: Catherine McKenzie
Title: Run large
Review: These are definitely more on the 3T end. Not the best durability for an active toddler. Got holes in the toes pretty quick despite being a little large. Great patterns and colors.

Name: Victoria L Young
Title: Just okay
Review: I purchased these socks from Amazon because they were from the Carter’s company, whom I typically buy from for my LO’s clothing, and I got more socks for less (when compared to the Carter’s website). These socks come with grippers on the bottom (which I didn’t realize when I purchased them) and my LO’s previous socks (from Carter’s, just a size down) did not. It took him some getting used to. They’re also not as tall as Carter’s socks I had previously purchased. I recently purchased some socks from the J Crew Outlet (size small) and they fit the same on my LO’s foot as the Amazon socks but they’re taller (which I prefer). I wouldn’t purchase these again as I don’t feel the quality is the same as you would get directly from Carter’s, my son didn’t like going from no grippers back to grippers and they weren’t tall enough.

Name: Jessica Kondracki
Title: Socks wore out in 3 months
Review: Socks wore out in 3 months

Name: Kckid89
Title: Pretty good
Review: 2T-3T size fits my son well who wears a size 8 shoe. The colors and patterns are cute. They stretch well and don’t stick up as high as you would expect. Pretty good quality, my son did rip a hole in one the first day he wore a pair, probably because there was a bouncy house at daycare and he was jumping around in his socks.

Name: Prime Finishes
Title: Order size smaller
Review: Glad I trusted previous reviews on sizing. Thank you folks!  Ordered the 2T-3T for 3-1/2 year old. They are roomy but not too large. Nice colors and look very comfy. He wears a size 9-1/2 shoe. I anticipate the socks will fit through a couple more sizes because they stretch.

Name: Liz Hutchison
Title: Shorted one pair
Review: These socks seem great quality and color. I was shorted on pair though, 11 out of 12. I really don't want to send the whole package back for one pair.

Name: Katie
Title: Good socks - little small
Review: I love these socks because they’re high - good for a constantly-moving 16 month old boy. The grips on the bottom keep him from eating dirt every 2 minutes too. BUT, like most socks for little ones, the size is just a little small from toe to heel. It doesn’t effect the function of the sock and they don’t fall down because of it or anything, but I wish they were just a bit bigger so the heel would stay in place. I’d buy them again.

Name: Marlene Coronado
Title: Un poco apretados de arriba
Review: Los calcetines son de buena calidad y si corresponden al tamaño; sin embargo me pareció que están más apretados de la parte superior en la pierna.

Name: Rebecca Smith
Title: Love the grippers on the soles, comfortable for my son and the elastic stays up
Review: These were great socks for my son, aged 4.  Loved that they have grippers on the bottom since we have hardwood floors and are spending so much time at home.  The patterns are fun and colorful and go with everything.  Well made and the elastic holds the sock up well.  Not too much stitching on the inside given the patterns. My only complaint is that they did begin to shrink after multiple washings and we didn't get to wear them for as long as I hoped considering there are so many pairs in the pack.  They seemed to get small after only a few months.  Overall, good quality for the money and I would recommend as long as you don't expect to wear them longer than 6 months.

Name: small but mighty
Title: Great socks- comfort, fit and pattern for a 2 yr old
Review: Love everything about these socks. The patterns are nice and provide a great variety - my son can pick out a pair every day. They are soft and feel nice- not too thin and not too thin. I do think they will be great for cool temperature/ early winter temperature ( Chicago weather). The only reason for 4 stars vs 5 ( and really 4.5 stars) is that one pair already came with a hole in the ankle portion. They have not been used yet so that was disappointing. However I do love them so I am keeping them.

Name: Jessica W
Title: A little big but room to grow
Review: My kiddo has pretty big feet for 2-3T, and these were a bit large on him. But I consider that a plus so he can grow into them and I don't have to buy more socks for awhile. Just a heads up.

Name: Renee Waller
Title: Soft
Review: Fit well

Name: ori68
Title: These are great
Review: These are great. They fit a 11 month old a tad big but it is fine for around the house. They also have a non skid bottom to help when walking for the first few times.

Name: William
Title: Perfect fit for active Twin Grandsons
Review: These socks are very good quality. And are great for one year old twin Grandsons that are very active

Name: Ann Y Moss
Title: No plastic
Review: I haven’t even washed these yet but was so happy I don’t have to snip a single (let alone 50) plastic tags to unpackaged these.  That is wonderful.  I HATE cutting kids socks out of the packaging.  I don’t know if they were returned but they are brand new and look great.

Name: MKeegan
Title: Grippers on the bottom a plus!
Review: Fits to size sock with the added bonus of small grippy circles on the bottom.

Name: Martine

Review: Pretty bought it for my 17 month old !

Review: Good quality. Bought for my 4T son and he uses it for everyday. It's been an year, but still works well.

Review: Recibi el paquete sellado,  la sorpresa fue que al abrirla venia con un corte adelante y atras la prenda asi no me sirve!!!

Review: I like it but I was so disappointed that it came with ink lines by pocket as if they were used to mark where pocket was to go, but they are soooo noticeable.  Why would someone use an ink pen to mark?  I ordered several of them and 6 had the ink marks

Name: Kyle Johnston
Title: There is blue pen all over the shirt!!!

Name: O Fam

Name: Madalyn Kaltz

Review: The shirt fit fine but had no stretch or give for a 2 year old. It also wrinkled really badly which was beyond what an iron could remedy.

Name: renee williams
Title: Disappointed
Review: The shirt had been used previously i believe.  There was no tag, it smelled strongly of a perfume/cologne, and it has some kind of substance on the sleeve that will hopefully wash out.

Name: Brmuns06
Title: Blue Pen Marks all over it
Review: I just got this today and it would be a 5 star review except it’s covered in blue pen marks.

Name: Jessica
Title: Ink marks
Review: Like several other reviews, the shirt came with blue pen marks around the chest pocket.  I was unable to get it out and didn’t have time to exchange before the event. Material is decent and style is cute.

Name: JT
Title: So disapointed
Review: This shirt was clearly worn and returned, has a stain on the front and the cuffs are dirty from wear otherwise fits as expected

Name: Chenelle
Title: Blue ink
Review: I ordered this baby boys button up shirt for my son to wear to a wedding. By the time I got it it was too late to return. It came with blue pen markings on it.

Name: Amazon Customer
Title: Damaged Shirt (2 times)
Review: Appears to be a 'bad batch' of 18 month white shirts.  First shirt came with pen marks around the pocket and neck of shirt.  A new one was shipped but has the same issue.

Name: Eva Martinez
Title: Tienen que checar bien el tipo de tela
Review: A simple vista está bien pero algo en la tela le dio mucha comezón en la espalda y en su brazos a mi niño no se a que se debió pero no fue un buen momento

Name: B. Martin
Title: Disappointed
Review: I was a bit disappointed with this shirt. Bought it for my 7 month old son's school pictures and it didn't fit properly. Tried to button the shirt all the way up to the neck because he had a bow tie to put on for his pictures and it was way too tight. So tight that it would've choked him. Unfortunately, the shirt was a last minute buy and I didn't have time to return it or buy another one before his pictures so he had to take them without the bow tie.

Name: MARIO BELTRAN
Title: Neck was too small
Review: I know I have a little chunky monkey but this shirt was too small to fit around his neck while buttoned up.  He's about 20lbs and I got the 12-18 months size, he's almost 6 months 😬The shirt was wide enough but the neck was too snug.

Name: Janet B
Title: Size off, color didnt match same shirt bought bigger size on same order
Review: Fit small, color was off. Purchased matching shirts for photos, smaller shirt was yellow/white. Both shirts purchased at same time. Couldn't use shirts, different shades of white. I will be returning.Cotton fabric very coarse.

Title: Socks on or off?
Review: These socks are absolutely amazing! I never knew socks could be so funny, but these ones had me laughing from the moment I took them out of the package. The white and grey are a nice neutral color, and the pink add a touch of whimsy. But the real reason these socks are so great is the fact that they don't stay on your feet for more than a few seconds. As soon as your little girl looks at them on her feet, those socks will be flying off her feet like they're on fire. It's like a never-ending game of sock toss. So if you want to keep your toddler entertained for hours (and drive yourself absolutely bonkers in the process), these are the socks for you!In all seriousness, though, these socks are great. They're made of high-quality materials that are soft and comfortable, and they're designed to fit snugly without being too tight. They're also super durable, so they'll hold up well to all the wear and tear that comes with being a toddler's socks. And the best part is, they're machine washable, so you can toss them in the laundry and they'll come out looking like new.Overall, I highly recommend these grey, white, and pink girls' socks. They're cute, comfortable, and lots of fun. Your little girl will love wearing them, and you'll love watching her run around with them on. It's a win-win situation!

Title: Not what I ordered
Review: I ordered newborn and get 0-3 months. Not what I ordered, way to big for a 5 lb 5oz baby. When she is able to wear this it might be to warm out. They had several sizes listed I choose newborn and anyone that knows about baby clothes knows they difference in size.

Name: Amazon Customer
Title: Cute but big!
Review: This set is really cute and soft. The peach color IS more of a neon in person as some have said but I actually like it still. However I found this set to be SO big! Surprised by those saying it runs small. My little one is 14 mos and petite. She still wears a size 12mos in carters but they are just perfect, as in grow out of those in like a month or so. Figured I’d start buying next size up- 18mos. Didn’t realize simple joys by carter would be so different than actual carters. I have a pair of 18mos pants that can fit her today. However these 18mos pants are ridiculously baggy and like double the length of the other one. She is swimming in them. It’ll be many months before they actually look normal on her. So definitely do not try to compare carters size to simple joys by carters size, it is way off.

Name: kayla
Title: Didn't receive the correct articles of clothing
Review: The outfits are super cute and I want to give them a 5-star rating, however, they gave me two pairs of blue pants in two different sizes. One in newborn and one in preemie, when I ordered newborn and was supposed to receive one pair of blue and one pair of pink and white stripes. Kinda bummed that I only got one pair of pants now and a pair my baby will not fit in.

Name: Brianne S.
Title: Missing Grey Onesie
Review: Love these sets but disappointed that a piece was missing.

Name: Jevon Young
Title: Nice, but HUGE
Review: Fun patterns — but not the same ones shown online. When compared to other onesies marked with the same size these are much, much, much bigger. Guess we'll hold on to them for next year because there's no way they'll fit her before then.

Name: Sami
Title: Very cute
Review: Very cute

Name: BDoaks

Review: Good product

Name: Mother of the Groom
Title: Cute as a button
Review: Bought this for Easter because of the bunnies but it’s soft and versatile so it’s good for Spring and cool summer nights too. Washes well and many pieces for the money.

Name: Daisy
Title: No tags
Review: I think these were really cute but I don't like that there wasn't anything indicating this item was new, no tags, no stickers with size and label on them, it just comes in a transparent plastic bag. I would have liked to give this as a gift with a tag so they knew it was new not just something I found used.

Name: Amy Rodman
Title: Look at the animal on the front closely, don't hurt someone's feelings on accident.
Review: I like the colors and the sizes. However, I didn't notice that the animals on the front of one of the t-shirts were elephants. A mom elephant and her baby. Ended up hurting someone's feelings that has a weight issue. It would be a good idea to change the Mom animal to a Mama Bear. Thank you

Name: Mel
Title: Love'm
Review: Cool I love them, cute on my baby

Name: hipchick127
Title: Too tight pants. Bodysuits fit well.
Review: I have used both the preemie size and rhr NB size for my baby over the last 2 months. The bodysuits fit fairly well except the sleeves are long and I have to roll them up on my baby. The pants are so tight in the waist we can’t even use them and my baby is a tiny peanut! The preemie size especially had too tight pants. Then newborn size isn’t as tight for some reason.

Name: Frank Fioretto
Title: Nice set !
Review: Was good price !

Name: Alyssa C
Title: Cute!
Review: Cute little preemie set I had to buy in a pinch for my 6 lb newborn. Shipping was fast (thank goodness as everything else was huge!) great quality and held up in the wash. The fit was wonderful from 6-8 lbs.

Name: Steve
Title: Multiple outfits
Review: Super cute but not the quality I wanted.

Name: Kayy
Title: Buy them!
Review: So worth getting this set, even though my kid has totally pooped up the shirts and pants I’ll still give this set an A+ for being a great barrier between my nice shirt and her poop.

Name: Evonne Sullivan
Title: Perfect
Review: These were a little big for my two month old daughter but I think it’s because she was born as a preemie. I’m sure she’ll grow into them just fine. I like how soft the clothes are and how they are just like the pictures shown. Carters never lets me down.

Name: Fatima shearer

Name: Kay

Name: Fei Fei Ng

Review: I bought one set of 12-18m before and they worked well so I bought another set.  But the repurchase was a failure because the waistbands were so loose that the pants keep sliding down.  I wish the quality control was better.

Name: Andrea
Title: WARNING...NOT NEW

Name: Stacey Scott
Title: Not a four pack!
Review: The product itself is fine, but I didn’t receive four In my pack. It arrived a week late which isn’t a big deal but it only had three in it. Not usually disappointed with Amazon but they kinda dropped the ball with this one.

Name: MaeMaeT
Title: 12 month size is too small for 7 month baby
Review: I got these in the 12 month size so my son (7 months old) could use his walker without his legs getting cold and have some room to grow,, but now I'm concerned he won't be able to walk in them. They are too tight and have zero stretch to them. The fabric has a constricted roll on his leg while sitting. May have to return them.

Name: Andrea
Title: If you want these definitely size up
Review: My son was able to wear these maybe twice.  The waistband isn't very stretchy and he outgrew them in about a week... some of them he never even wore but I packed them away into storage, unused.

Name: Dia
Title: Tight waistband
Review: Waistband is wayy to small for age. Plus I didnt want fleece pants.

Name: Tru
Title: Too small, no stretch and not soft
Review: The fabric is very coarse and doesn’t stretch at all and this is smaller than the average new born clothing. Though I was getting value for money but ended up wasting money as these are only good for 1 wear.

Name: ManVi
Title: These are a tad bit tight
Review: Got these because I loved 3-6 months size. Got the 6-9 months size but didn’t like them because they are tight in diaper area. They have no strech

Name: Kelly Carawan

Review: I would give 5 stars but since I should have gotten them in 2 days instead I waited a month for them , other than that they are great for my little one

Name: NK
Title: Rise in bottom is short, legs are too long. Pass on these
Review: Horrible patterning: The rise in the back (butt) is way too short, almost the same as the front, so it comes up way short in the back and high in the front. The legs are too long but rolling them up for a while is always an option. The issue is really just the rise in the back being so short, they fit more like a 6-9m pant cut.

Name: Katina Carroll
Title: To Small
Review: For some reason these are not the same size as most 18 to 24 month's. They are way to short. I was not happy with the quality of them either. If you decide to buy these go up a size.

Name: Mary Callard
Title: Soft but tight band.
Review: Not exactly what I was expecting. Soft but tight waist band. The band is wide but tight on a chubby baby belly. Sizing is also slightly small, my 4 month old is tall but the 6-9 month are getting small

Name: C
Title: tight
Review: bought 12 months size and it is tight fit on my 3 months

Name: Vin B

Review: Bought it for my 6 month old. The waist is too tight and not that stretchable so used it only for couple of weeks. Would not buy it any more. May be good for petite babies

Title: It’s more a 6 to 12 months size
Review: It’s too big. I have other Carters pants that I bought at the store and they are completely different sizes. My boy is going to grow but since these are fleece pants, I hope he is that size on winter

Name: T.T.
Title: Runs small
Review: Cute and soft but run very small

Name: Trudy
Title: No stretch
Review: These pants have no stretch to them only thing is that they are soft. Stretch in material 0

Name: Elle
Title: Runs SMALL
Review: These are soft and warm, but they run very small in the waist.  Unfortunately we did not get any real use out of them.  If you're considering these pants, I would order a size up at least or use the try before you buy feature.

Name: Sf
Title: Band too tight
Review: The band was sooo tight on him and he is tiny ! Had to cut the sides so it wasn’t strangulating  and to make them more comfortable for him

Name: everett
Title: Soft but small waist
Review: Very warm and soft pants with good length, but the elastic is tight in the waist. Not a good fit for a baby with any chub on his belly.

Name: A.S.
Title: Runs very small around the waist
Review: Length is good but waist is tight. My baby is 26.5” long and 18# and the 12M size is too tight on him.

Name: Samarpan
Title: This is exactly what I looking for my 15months old boy
Review: Happy with purchase overall.it’s soft and comfortable !! Good for winters!! I ordered one size bigger and it’s fits perfectly fine!! Definitely ordering more soon

Name: Beth

Name: Serrld113
Title: Very small
Review: My baby is 9mo and in the 80th percentile and these are way too small. I’m thinking the 18m will fit better.

Name: Nikkya Currie

Review: I bought these in a preemie size for my son who weighed about 5 lbs at the time. The elastic in the waistband was too tight. I recommend sizing up if your preemie is in the 5-6 lbs range.

Name: Sully
Title: Me encanto
Review: Me gusto mucho

Name: RaNae Montoya
Title: Cute and soft
Review: I bought these for a gift so don't really know how they fit, but when I took them out of the package they looked small for 18 month size. They are very cute though.

Name: Michelle
Title: So soft
Review: They are great pants fit perfectly and so very soft

Name: Jeanette Brown
Title: Soft and comfy
Review: These little jogger are so soft and comfortable for my grandson

Name: Waggly One
Title: Soft and warm
Review: I bought these for the winter months to keep baby warm, size 6-9month.Warm and soft these worked great.The ankle cuffs were nice, helped keep pants on properly. Towards the last month in this size, they started getting kinda tight in the waist area.If you have a dog, the dog hair will stick to these like mad and washing only weaves the hair into the pants. Invest in roller brushes.

Name: Wendi McClintic
Title: A little bit smaller
Review: Runs small

Name: Victoria
Title: So soft and comfortable
Review: These pants are so soft and comfortable I highly recommend them especially if you have a baby with sensitive skin. My son is fairly tall and he fit in the 6 to 9 months size when he was about 5 to 7 months

Name: Cmg
Title: Softness,  comfort & durability
Review: These are very soft, that's very important to me & my Granddaughter,  the twins mom. I got these for my twin great grandsons.  Softness,  fit & comfort is very important.  They're just 3 months old

Name: taehyun park
Title: Warm. Thermal!!!
Review: As you know, baby grows pretty quickly. Instead of buying many clothing. I have bought few. These pants are one of them. Excellent quality. Warm. 4 pairs in this price. Why not?!!!! I bought the thermal t-shirts as well. Perfect and right clothing for the winter

Name: Pitollie
Title: Nice set of baby pants
Review: Great set of sweat pants for your little one to hang out in. They also have matching tops, but since they snap in the crouch and my baby wont sit still for that, I passed on the tops. But these go with about everything and he wears them a lot.

Name: Jaymie
Title: So warm, so soft
Review: Bought 12 month size and fits our 19 lb - six month old with lots of room to grow. Little big but we roll the bottom legs and waist. Yes, 19lbs..mamas milk, love those rolls on the legs! Very soft, very warm, very comfy. If you live in a colder state..don’t look any farther!

Name: Teasella
Title: A must in your baby’s winter wardrobe
Review: We live in a cold climate where winter is 5-6 months long out of the year so having fleece anything helps! I got these for my son as the weather is shifting to colder days. These are really soft and warm and they are great for those cold days in the months to come. I have ordered these in smaller sizes before and will continue to order some more in the near future when he gets a bit bigger. Overall - highly recommend if you live somewhere cold and need something to keep your babe’s warm!

Name: Mistie M
Title: Love these!!
Review: These are just like they say. They are very soft with a nice soft stretchy waistband. I like that they also have the cotton stretchy cuff around the ankle too. They fit true to size. My son has almost outgrown them and I already want to order him the next size up.

Name: Rachel W
Title: Perfect!!!
Review: Unlike most baby clothes, these don’t restrict at the waistline leading to increased comfort. I won’t buy any other pants for baby as a result and bought these in the next size up already. Price isn’t great but I want to make sure my little one is comfortable so I’ll take the hit

Name: Kittymom
Title: Adorable baby pants
Review: These are soft, warm, comfortable and look adorable.

Name: KJs Mommy
Title: Buy a size bigger
Review: The pants fit as expected for my 6 month old. They are really soft and the waist will not stretch out of shape

Name: Jennifer
Title: Arrived dirty with a musty/moldy smell
Review: Last year I purchased the 18-24 month size of these bibs and loved them, which is why I purchased the next size up for this winter season. I was super disappointed when they arrived and I noticed they had gray dust on them. After taking a close look (and whiff), they smelled so musty and moldy.  I also recently purchased a pair of Arctix snow boots, and the box arrived EMPTY.  I'm not sure who is at fault for that one, but Amazon was quick to remedy the problem. However, after TWO failed attempts at trying to acquire quality goods from Arctix, I suppose it's time to move on from this brand.

Name: Liege M. Gonzalez
Title: Straps don't snap on and off
Review: The straps in these pants don't Snap-on and off, as with most other pants of this kind. This means that when your toddler wants to poo in the ski slopes, you will have to remove his coat in order to pull down his pants in the tiny filthy freezing Ski Lodge cubicle. Even if he only wants to pee you will also have to do that since the zipper won't come down to his crotch. The material and finishing are excellent, these are good quality pants, but I give it one star because this is a major design flaw for me. I wish someone else had written a one-star review like this because I would not have bought it if I had known. Ive never had pants with no snap ons so it didn't occur to me to check before buying. I don't have time to return them before my next ski trip so Let's hope there will be no accidents in the cubicle.  That's also hope Arctix reads this review and and snap-on's in their pants, because they do make good snow gear.

Name: Ann Johnson
Title: Horrific mold smell
Review: I never write reviews but these snow pants were awful due to a terrible mold and mildew smell. As soon as I took it out of the plastic packaging, I could smell it. And someone sitting across the room could smell it. A truly disgusting and alarming odor.  Hopefully just a fluke or one-off, but wanted to post a warning here to others, just in case. I will return/request a refund.

Name: Allie Gavin
Title: Terrible quality
Review: My son wore these 2 times. The second time he was playing out in the snow and slid on his knees and they completely ripped…not just the outer layer but all the way through. I am very disappointed, and does not seem like I am eligible for a refund because I cannot return them in the condition they were sent to me. I’m hoping Amazon can make this right…

Name: ZG
Title: Falsely advertised
Review: NO POCKETS - which would not bother me, except that they state on the tag and packaging: "zipper pockets" and "hand warmer pockets".Also, I ordered 4T, the tag says "4T" and the tag on the inside is for 3T!So where are the pockets? Why the mislabeling? I'm not a fan of false advertising, so it makes me not trust the product or company. Will be reutrning.Also, the pants aren't that great anyway:No zippers at the bottom, no bungees to tighten, very limited size adjustment option, no fleece/soft lining. The features/design is really limited. The ones we are replacing from Children's Place were about the same price and had many more features and better design.

Name: David S.
Title: Terrible quality
Review: I am shocked these snow pants have so many good reviews. I usually buy my kids Columbia snow gear, but decided to save a few bucks and try these. My son has worn them for about a month and every time he wears them, his pants underneath get soaking wet. The other day he walked by a branch and the pants ripped wide open. Not made for New Hampshire winters, total waste of money!

Name: Beatriz
Title: Defective: Short Straps
Review: I bought the BLACK 18 MONTHS for my 11 month old (he is average in height) thinking it would last him long for a while. The suit doesn't fit him even if I extend the straps to the maximum (not very elastic straps either by the way), he was crying because of the tightness. The leg's length/size is fine though, but doesn't matter, this suit is absolutely defective.

Name: PartridgeFamily14
Title: CAN'T GET RID OF THE SMELL!!
Review: These snow pants must have been stored in a moldy storage facility because it reeks!  I have washed these snow pants SEVERAL times and cannot get rid of the smell.  I would NOT recommend these snow pants.

Name: Top Contributor: Baby
Title: No free returns
Review: I liked the product but when I got it it didn't fit my one year old. I wanted to make an exchange and there is option for that beside returning it. It says free returns but I have to pay to return it.

Name: lisbeht
Title: Too Small, great quality (runs small) size up
Review: I bought the 24 month size for my toddler who is a little 2 years old and a little over 32" and when the overalls were on and it was time for the straps to be over his shoulders, it was way to tight by the crotch area and i loosened it to the max, SIZE UP! so what ended up doing was zipped it up to his mid stomach so he wore them like high waist pants and left the straps out.

Name: Megan
Title: Runs small!
Review: These run super small! My 2 year old is not tall by any means but even with the straps at their longest length they barely fit over her shoulders

Name: Amazon Customer
Title: Short torso
Review: Very cute! But had to return. The torso was just way too short for my toddler.

Name: Mickey
Title: Not for tall torsos!
Review: Although they held up well to the cold and wet not matter how much I loosened the straps my kiddo had a perma-wedgie. The torso area was extremely short, I had even sized up for my toddler so I was a little disappointed. If your kiddo has ANY sort of above average height, do NOT get these. They are more for the short skinny kiddos. My 3 year old wears a 3T, he is a whopping 32 pounds and about 3 feet tall and these in 4T still ran too short. I dunno if it was just the pair I got or what but he was not having it.

Name: Amazon Customer
Title: Too small
Review: Ordered a 2T and the size is same as 12m.

Name: halee
Title: Wrong size
Review: I ordered the blue set in size 4T and they came just in time for some snow fun. Too bad I received a size 10/12 (which isn't even an option on this listing) so they were completely useless and my little girl was bummed. Now the price is way up from when I bought them also. They seem decent quality, wish it would have worked out.

Name: recia smith
Title: Zipper came broken
Review: Opened the package held it up to my son and was going to have him try it on.  Zipper is stuck and won't unzip so he can. Despise having to return things because it's so far to a ups store so I'm out the money.

Name: Christine Lawrence
Title: Smelled of mildew/mold out of the package.
Review: Received package. Box wasn't damaged and bag looked ok but once I opened the bag, the snowsuit smelled horrible. Smelled like mildew/mold. Tried washing a couple times and still has a slight mildew smell.

Name: Rachel Aardal
Title: OK for the price, but you get what you pay for..
Review: First off.. I selected "like new" condition and received a VERY used article of clothing. There was even a name written on the tag in big black letters. I ordered up a size so that my 10 month old can hopefully wear it again next season- bought the 18 month. It surprisingly fits fine, just long (as expected) so I will fold the legs a bit and cuff. But even more surprising was that it fit perfect around his waist! My little dude is tall (100 percentile) and lean (only 26th percentile for weight).. so anyone with a cute chunky little baby may have difficultly fitting into these. Can't imagine it fitting well if he had any chubbiness to him.

Name: David
Title: Size up!
Review: Bought 12 month size for our almost 1yr old, who can still fit into 9-12mo clothing. When putting the overalls on they looked great until trying to put the straps over his shoulders. I lengthened the straps as much as they would allow, still no good. It was way too tight in the groin area and there was no way he could sit/stand up straight. Ended up using them as high waisted pants.

Name: Chris and Amber Middleton
Title: Runs SMALL
Review: received these pants for my twin girls (16 months old) They are on the petite side, so i was debating on the size. I ended up going with 18 months and thought they would be huge on them but would allow them to grow into the pants buuuut they were incredibly too SMALL! I return them and now waiting for the 24 months size. Hoping to have better luck with those. Material is great though! Although, it also advertises pockets but there are no pockets on the black ones... not that important to me though since they don’t use pockets lol

Name: Sir Arthur
Title: Snug fit
Review: As others have mentioned, get the size up. My kids usually wears a 2t and the 2t/3t was barely big enough. He is 33.5" tall. He also has quite the beer belly but this was no problem....then again it could've been the reason why it is tight in the butt area.

Name: R.B
Title: No pockets
Review: Okay. So the tag that is attached to these snow pants says there's zip pockets AND hand warmer pockets. There are zero pockets on these. There's another tag that says it can keep you warm from -20° to 35°. I'm not sure how much I believe the rest of the info, considering two of the advertised features are false. If you're wanting pockets, pass on these.

Name: rmd440
Title: Great looking warm pants, size runs small
Review: Nice snowpants for warmth, runs smallI ordered 12mo size for 11 month old child, but was to small. We could not zip it up with the straps fully extended was so short throughout the torso  . So disappointing because it is nice material and looks cute.

Name: Ethan gamble
Title: Not bad
Review: I was super excited to get these since my area its really hard to find snowpants in the size I need (weird for northern Minnesota but oh well 🤷‍♀️). They looked cute and good quality, but they DEFINITELY run small. I got the 18 month for my 1 year old and it's a snug fit with no room to grow.

Name: Cosmiccatoe
Title: Runs small
Review: I went off of the infant size chart in their pictures. I couldn't even get the straps over her shoulders because the torso was too short. I didn't notice this until after I pulled the tags off, so now I can't return. Runs very small!

Name: Drew Novelli
Title: Cute but smells awful
Review: Item looked as described but had such an awful smell to it right out of the package. I do not want my daughter to wear anything that smells like that. Will be returning.

Name: T.Smith
Title: Color not as shown
Review: I’m very disappointed. These bibs have great reviews, but I won’t even get to try them b/c the color we ordered is way different than the color shown. They are very hot pink & do not match the jacket I bought them to go w/.

Name: Annon
Title: Nice, waterproof pants but cuff ripped off after only a few uses.
Review: The first time out I wanted to love these snowpants. In fact, I DO love them. However, tonight while putting them on to go sledding we discovered that there was a rip at the cuff of his right leg. Is it a huge deal? No. Is it super annoying? Absolutely.Also, my toddler is devastated that his snowpants are "ruined". He's worn them only a handful of times this year and today, 15 days after the return window closed, they are ripped.Apparently there's no way to contact the seller except to leave a review so here's hoping they get in touch with me to figure out a solution. I spent good money on brand new snowpants so that they would LAST not so that I could buy a second pair halfway through the season.His older brothers snowpants (same listing just a bigger size) are perfectly fine. Both pairs are waterproof and warm. Literally my only issue is that the little dudes pants ripped and aren't fixable.

Name: Ron W.
Title: Received 4 months after order date
Review: The product seems to be of high quality, but we received the item 4 months after we ordered. The return window ended 1 month after the order date, so we are stuck with something that doesn't fit and is out of season. Would have liked a way to contact the seller and explain the situation because the item is no longer needed, but there was no way to on the site. Also would have liked a better heads-up that the order would take so long to fulfill.

Name: A. Bue
Title: Good quality
Review: Runs small

Name: David
Title: Came Opened
Review: Good snowsuit. But package came ripped open.

Name: lisa
Title: Nice gift
Review: Made a 4 yr old happy to have unicorns on her much needed snowpants.

Name: Christa
Title: Not great for chunky babies
Review: Love these snow pants overall but if your baby has a nice little potbelly on them, you might want order a size up. Length will be plenty long (I have a tall baby) but you can always roll the pants. We originally had the 18 month (as a 12 month old) and the front zipper was always a little too snug. We just left it unzipped and put her jacket over it, but we had to go up to a 2T when winter really got rolling.

Name: law student
Title: Very warm/dry, but maybe order a size up
Review: My son seemed to love these, he seemed comfortable and warm, but I would suggest ordering a size up. My son is just starting to get into 2T (still fits in 24 month in pants) so I ordered the 2T but these seemed a little tight around the crotch area, not enough to make it uncomfortable for him and he was still able to move around, but I expected them to be a little bit bigger.I will say that he stayed dry with these and his boots so I was very happy to see that he could have fun and warm/dry.

Name: Rebecca
Title: Good value but sizing is off
Review: In terms of warmth and water resistance, these worked well. However, I ordered a size 24mo for my 18mo child (who typically runs a little smaller for her age) and the snow pants from crotch to shoulder were just barely long enough. One good growth spurt and they will be too small. I purposely ordered the larger size to fit over layers and be sure I could use them for one full season and I’m not sure how possible that is.

Name: D garcia
Title: Good
Review: It seems like good quality but it same with a mark on it. I tried to get it out with some dawn and a washcloth but it seems as if its glue of some sort and is not going to come out. So that sucks but seeing as we had to use it the day we got it we couldnt return for a different one.

Name: Em
Title: Came dirty and used but will work for what i need.
Review: This will work for what i bought them for and they did fit my son. (I got the 5T. He’s 47 lbs)But they came in an open package and have definitely been worn which is a little bummer.

Name: Mary C Dennis
Title: Really fits exactly true to size
Review: Ordered a 3T for my 3.5 yr old and they weren’t kidding about it being exactly true to size - it was decidedly too small for him. He just went through a growth spurt and although he has too tiny a waist for 4T he needs the length. Return was no sweat, 4T should be here any day. He was very annoyed i wouldn’t let him keep it as other than the length it fit him well. Seems very warm, i am pleased.

Name: Amazon Customer
Title: Colors are a little off
Review: We bought 3 pairs for our 2, 3 and 4yo boys.  The pants are nice but will most likely only last one season.  One wear and a knew is already stained with a hole.The orange actually looks pink.  The red isn’t really red.  The only one we actually like is the lighter orange that’s actually orange!  Next time we will stick to darker colors…but they were a bit delayed in shipping!

Name: Shannon Henry
Title: Buy a size bigger than you need
Review: They run small and don’t have any type of adjustment feature. Buy a size bigger and you should be good

Name: Bridget
Title: Other that that concern of mine these are great!
Review: Update****We love these overalls! We used them a couple of times and they keep my baby warm. My son loves them too! I can tell he is comfortable in them.  I was worried the suit would be uncomfortable but it has stretch to it on the shoulder straps that fixed the concern I had in the beginning. I would definitely recommend.****We love these snow overalls. We have not used them outside yet but they look durable and good quality. My son is 15months and he is 30in tall and weighs 25lbs, we got him the 24M size. They fit perfectly (just a tad bit long in length) but they maybe good only for this winter season or if he goes through a growth spurt in the next couple of weeks they may not fit him anymore or perhaps they will since the straps on the shoulders are elasticity. My concern with this is if he grows it may be uncomfortable in the area between his legs. Other that that concern of mine these are great!

Name: Biochemliz
Title: Excellent bibs... Even in subzero Alaska temps!
Review: We purchased these for a trip to Alaska in December 2021. They were worn 13 out of 15 days for all kinds of adventures... Sledding, ice skating, sleigh rides, dogsledding, and even Northern Lights hunting a few nights. We dressed the 3yr old in leggings and a long sleeved shirt, and put these and a good coat over top. She never once complained about being cold. Now, time to find these in a bigger size for the older kiddo. Absolutely recommend!!

Name: Courtney Smith
Title: Nice but run small
Review: Great quality - but I would highly recommend sizing up. I bought a size 12M for my toddler. He always wears 12M and it fits comfortably, however these were really pulling up his butt dispute being adjusted to the largest strap level

Name: Mila RAM
Title: just Size up
Review: Toddler 3 years weight 30 lbs and on the shorter size ordered him 4t but should of gotten the 5t just so he can wear again. It fit correctly the height and for the waist 4t for the win. Will be using this weekend hopefully it is durable warm and water resisten I’ll be updating post

Name: Rtothe
Title: Great quality!! Great fit!
Review: These pants are just as good as the expensive name brand equivalents. I am so happy with them. Have a pair for me, the husband, and my 3.5yo… very warm, water resistant… and great fit for all of us. We are narrow people and usually find ourselves swimming in snow pants.

Name: Isis Tinoco
Title: Me encanto ,
Review: Me gusto mucho la calidad de la tela y la suavidad al mismo tiempo ! Excelente compra gracias al vendedor y al fabricante!

Name: Kandy Byas
Title: Cute and warm!
Review: These are the cutest snow pants anywhere . They are for my little niece for Christmas. I thing they are going to be really warm I got them in purple and size 2T.

Name: Nell
Title: This snow bibs are perfect size and really warm for snow.
Review: 3  year old girl on plenty of snow in Maine.  Cold these are perfect for us.

Name: Haley
Title: Loveeee
Review: Love these! Fit is very TTS!

Name: Kat Grace
Title: Excellent!!
Review: These fit my 4 year old perfectly!! Very pleased!!
